title: 2020 BMW M8 Gran Coupe revealed with Competition and First Edition trims
text:
2020 BMW M8 Gran Coupe revealed with Competition and First Edition trims More

The 2020 BMW M8 Gran Coupe is here, a little over a year after the concept previewed the super sports sedan, and only months after the plain 8 Series Gran Coupe launched. In base trim, it produces 600 horsepower and 553 pound-feet of torque, and the Competition model bumps power up to 617 ponies. All this power allows the Gran Coupe to hit 60 mph just as quickly as the two-door model at 3.1 seconds for the regular M8 and 3.0 seconds for the Competition.

In base trim, it produces 600 horsepower and 553 pound-feet of torque, and the Competition model bumps power up to 617 ponies.  All this power allows the Gran Coupe to hit 60 mph just as quickly as the two-door model at 3.1 seconds for the regular M8 and 3.0 seconds for the Competition.
